1.name: Mary Poppins
1.description: In turn of the century London, a magical nanny employs music and adventure to help two neglected children become closer to their father.

2.name: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
2.description: An insane general triggers a path to nuclear holocaust that a War Room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.

3.name: Hush...Hush, Sweet Charlotte
3.description: An aging, reclusive Southern belle plagued by a horrifying family secret descends into madness after the arrival of a lost relative.

4.name: The Americanization of Emily
4.description: An American naval officer's talent for living the good life in wartime is challenged when he falls in love and is sent on a dangerous mission.

5.name: Les parapluies de Cherbourg
5.description: A young woman separated from her lover by war faces a life-altering decision.

6.name: Per un pugno di dollari
6.description: A wandering gunfighter plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge.

7.name: My Fair Lady
7.description: A snobbish phonetics professor agrees to a wager that he can take a flower girl and make her presentable in high society.

8.name: Goldfinger
8.description: While investigating a gold magnate's smuggling, James Bond uncovers a plot to contaminate the Fort Knox gold reserve.

9.name: 6 donne per l'assassino
9.description: A masked, shadowy killer brutally murders the models of a scandalous fashion house in Rome.

10.name: Marnie
10.description: Mark marries Marnie although she is a habitual thief and has serious psychological problems, and tries to help her confront and resolve them.

11.name: Zulu
11.description: Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.

12.name: Children of the Damned
12.description: Six impossibly intelligent children from all over the world with dangerous psychic powers hide in a church in England after the military tries to experiment on them. Besieged, they warn the military to back off before carnage ensues.

13.name: Man in the Middle
13.description: In WW2,a US lieutenant stationed in India shoots dead a British NCO and admits his crime but his reason for the murder is so bizarre that it puzzles his defense counsel.

14.name: A Hard Day's Night
14.description: Over two "typical" days in the life of The Beatles, the boys struggle to keep themselves and Paul McCartney's mischievous grandfather in check while preparing for a live television performance.

15.name: The Killers
15.description: Surprised that their contract victim didn't try to run away from them, two professional hit men try to find out who hired them and why.

16.name: Suna no onna
16.description: An entomologist on vacation is trapped by local villagers into living with a woman whose life task is shoveling sand for them.

17.name: The Fall of the Roman Empire
17.description: The death of Marcus Aurelius leads to a succession crisis, in which the deceased emperor's son, Commodus, demonstrates that he is unwilling to let anything undermine his claim to the Roman Empire.

18.name: Alexis Zorbas
18.description: An uptight English writer travelling to Crete, on a matter of business, finds his life changed forever when he meets the gregarious Alexis Zorba.

19.name: A Shot in the Dark
19.description: Inspector Jacques Clouseau investigates the murder of Mr. Benjamin Ballon's driver at a country estate.

20.name: Bullet for a Badman
20.description: Former Texas Rangers Sam Ward and Logan Keliher become enemies when Sam turns bank robber and Logan marries Sam's ex-wife.

21.name: Blind Corner
21.description: When the wife of a blind composer discovers that her husband will cut her out of his estate, if he discovers that she is having an affair with a young artist, she and her lover plan to commit the perfect murder.

22.name: The Night of the Iguana
22.description: A defrocked Episcopal clergyman leads a bus-load of middle-aged Baptist women on a tour of the Mexican coast and comes to terms with the failure haunting his life.

23.name: Father Goose
23.description: During World War II, a man persuaded to live on an isolated island and spot aircraft finds himself responsible for a teacher and several students, all female.

24.name: Strait-Jacket
24.description: After a twenty-year stay at an asylum for a double murder, a mother returns to her estranged daughter where suspicions arise about her behavior.

25.name: Kiss Me, Stupid
25.description: Jealous piano teacher Orville Spooner sends his beautiful wife, Zelda, away for the night while he tries to sell a song to famous nightclub singer Dino, who is stranded in town.

26.name: Fail-Safe
26.description: American planes are sent to deliver a nuclear attack on Moscow, but it's a mistake due to an electrical malfunction. Can all-out war be averted?

27.name: Viva Las Vegas
27.description: Race car driver Lucky Jackson goes to Las Vegas to earn money to pay for a new engine for his motor car. Working as a waiter, he still finds the time to court young Rusty Martin.

28.name: Becket
28.description: King Henry II of England comes to terms with his affection for his close friend and confidant Thomas Becket, who finds his true honor by observing God's divine will rather than the King's.

29.name: What a Way to Go!
29.description: A four-time widow discusses her four marriages, in which all of her husbands became incredibly rich and died prematurely because of their drive to be rich.

30.name: The Last Man on Earth
30.description: When a disease turns all of humanity into the living dead, the last man on earth becomes a reluctant vampire hunter.

31.name: Il deserto rosso
31.description: In an industrial area, Giuliana, an unstable woman, attempts to cope with life by starting an affair with a co-worker at the plant her husband manages.

32.name: Onibaba
32.description: Two women kill samurai and sell their belongings for a living. While one of them is having an affair with their neighbor, the other woman meets a mysterious samurai wearing a bizarre mask.

33.name: The Train
33.description: In 1944, a German colonel loads a train with French art treasures to send to Germany. The Resistance must stop it without damaging the cargo.

34.name: The Pawnbroker
34.description: A Jewish pawnbroker, victim of Nazi persecution, loses all faith in his fellow man until he realizes too late the tragedy of his actions.

35.name: Guns of Diablo
35.description: Wagon train scout Linc Murdock reminisces about his old feud with rancher Rance Macklin over pretty Maria during the time when Linc worked for the Macklin ranch.

36.name: The Masque of the Red Death
36.description: A European prince terrorizes the local peasantry while using his castle as a refuge against the "Red Death" plague that stalks the land.

37.name: First Men in the Moon
37.description: When a spaceship lands on the moon, it is hailed as a new accomplishment, before it becomes clear that a Victorian party completed the journey in 1899, leading investigators to that mission's last survivor.

38.name: The Naked Kiss
38.description: Kelly, a prostitute, traumatised by an experience, referred to as 'The Naked Kiss,' by psychiatrists, leaves her past, and finds solace in the town of Grantville. She meets Griff, the ...                See full summary »

39.name: Lilith
39.description: A war veteran gets work at a mental institution where he meets the beautiful, but eccentric, Lilith.

40.name: Bande à part
40.description: Two crooks with a fondness for old Hollywood B-movies convince a languages student to help them commit a robbery.

41.name: Seven Days in May
41.description: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty and they fear a Soviet sneak attack.

42.name: The Incredible Mr. Limpet
42.description: Meek and mild mannered bookkeeper Henry Limpet has few passions in life. It's mid-1941 and he would love to join the Navy but has been rated 4F. His friend George Stickle is in the Navy and...                See full summary »

43.name: Bedtime Story
43.description: Two scam artists prey on women for their money. They clash in a Mediterranean hot spot. Will the cultured, high-class con artist come out on top, or will the rough small-change scammer rise to win the wager?

44.name: Seance on a Wet Afternoon
44.description: A medium and her husband stage a kidnapping in order for her to pretend to solve the crime and achieve fame.

45.name: Matrimonio all'italiana
45.description: The rich man Domenico and Filumena, a penniless prostitute, share great part of their lives in the immediate post WWII Italy.

46.name: The Moon-Spinners
46.description: Travelling through Crete to collect folk songs for the BBC, a British teen and her aunt stumble upon local criminals who are peddling gems stolen from a London bank.

47.name: Surf Party
47.description: A young girl travels to California with a couple of friends in order to visit her brother, whom she hasn't seen for some time. After they arrive it doesn't take long for them to get into ...                See full summary »

48.name: Send Me No Flowers
48.description: A hypochondriac believes he is dying and makes plans for his wife which she discovers and misunderstands.

49.name: Cheyenne Autumn
49.description: The Cheyenne, tired of broken U.S. government promises, head for their ancestral lands but a sympathetic cavalry officer is tasked to bring them back to their reservation.

50.name: Man's Favorite Sport?
50.description: The author of a best-selling fishing guide is actually incredibly inexperienced when it comes to the sport, which causes mayhem when he is entered into a competition.
